author: itn3000
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

1. install 7zip for windows from https://www.7-zip.org/download.html
2. download pscore zip archive(like https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v6.1.0-preview.2/PowerShell-6.1.0-preview.2-win-x64.zip)
3. extract archive with 7z extract option

Expected behavior
-----------------

all of the contents in zip are extracted to output directory

Actual behavior
---------------

output following errors(output to `g:\temp\pwsh-610p2`) and cannot extract the `Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive`,`PackageManagement`,`PowerShellGet` in `Module` directory.
(extracting with explorer is OK.)

```none
...
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive\1.1.0.0\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive.cat
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive\1.1.0.0\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive.psd1
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive\1.1.0.0\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive.psm1
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive\1.1.0.0\en-US\ArchiveResources.psd1
...
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\coreclr
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\PackageManagement.cat
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\PackageManagement.format.ps1xml
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\PackageManagement.psd1
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\PackageManagement.psm1
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\PackageManagement.Resources.psd1
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\PackageProviderFunctions.psm1
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\coreclr\netcoreapp2.0\Microsoft.PackageManagement.ArchiverProviders.dll
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\coreclr\netcoreapp2.0\Microsoft.PackageManagement.CoreProviders.dll
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\coreclr\netcoreapp2.0\Microsoft.PackageManagement.dll
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\coreclr\netcoreapp2.0\Microsoft.PackageManagement.MetaProvider.PowerShell.dll

can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\coreclr\netstandard1.6\Microsoft.PackageManagement.dll
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\coreclr\netstandard1.6\Microsoft.PackageManagement.MetaProvider.PowerShell.dll
can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PackageManagement\1.1.7.0\coreclr\netstandard1.6\Microsoft.PackageManagement.NuGetProvider.dll

can not open output file g:\temp\pwsh-610p2\Modules\PowerShellGet\1.6.0\PowerShellGet.cat

...
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

* OS: Windows 8.1 x64
* Powershell version(zip file): 6.1.0-preview2, 6.0.2

comments.author: itn3000
comments.body:
I investigated this problem, and found the following 0 byte file entries in zip(not directory).

* Module\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive
* Module\PackageManagement
* Module\PowerShellGet

I guess this is the reason of failure.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I unzip the zip archive without problem. Please add more repo steps - 7zip version, command line with switches.

comments.author: itn3000
comments.body:
I'm very sorry that my 7-zip version was too old(9.20).
I updated the latest version(18.05), and then I successed the extract.

title: cannot extract some contents of windows zip archive with 7zip
